front.title: Use of CR-LDP or RSVP-TE to Extend 802.1Q Virtual LANs across MPLS Networks

abstract.t: This document presents a discussion on possible methods for extending Layer 2 Virtual LANs across MPLS networks through the use of CR-LDP or RSVP. Special note is taken on extending 802.1Q Tagged VLANs across MPLS networks. A new Forward Equivalence class called VLAN Forwarding Equivalence class (VFEC) is defined. Creating traffic engineered LSP based on P bit of the 802.1Q Tag is also a key focus of this document.
